hero.title: Challenge The Mountains
hero.subtitle: Experience the thrill of trail running through breathtaking mountain landscapes. Join runners from around the world in this unforgettable competition.
hero.enhancedDescription: The 33K race is part of the 2025 EMA Off-Road Running Circuit and the National Mountain Running Championship for Masters. An unforgettable experience awaits you in the beautiful Carpathian Mountains.

home.details: Experience the beauty of trail running with our 11km and 33km races in the Carpathian Mountains. The 33km race is part of the 2025 EMA Off-Road Running Circuit.
home.competitionDescription1: Join us for an unforgettable trail running experience in the breathtaking Carpathian Mountains. Our races offer challenging terrains with spectacular views, designed for both beginners and experienced trail runners.
home.competitionDescription2: The 33km race is part of the 2025 EMA Off-Road Running Circuit and the National Mountain Running Championship for Masters. The 11km race is perfect for those new to trail running or looking for a shorter challenge.
home.competitionDescription3: Both races take place on June 6, 2025, with professional timing, well-marked trails, and comprehensive support throughout the course.

races.title: Explore Our Races
races.subtitle: From beginner-friendly trails to challenging mountain ultras, find the perfect race for your level and ambition.

registration.title: Register for the Competition
registration.subtitle: Complete the form below to secure your spot in one of our races. Early registration ensures the best rates.

form.medicalPlaceholder: Please share any relevant medical information (allergies, conditions, etc.)
form.termsText: I have read and agree to the

success.title: Registration Successful

participants.tryDifferentFilter: Try a different filter or clear your search

rules.title: Rules & Regulations
rules.subtitle: Familiarize yourself with the competition rules to ensure a safe and fair race for everyone.

rules.1: Participants must follow the marked trail at all times. Taking shortcuts is strictly prohibited and will result in disqualification.
rules.2: Bib numbers must be visible at all times during the race.
rules.3: Littering on the trail is strictly prohibited. Use designated trash bins at aid stations.
rules.4: In case of emergency, participants must assist fellow runners and alert race officials immediately.

rules.2: Mobile phone with race organization contacts saved.
rules.3: Thermal blanket and whistle (50km race only).
rules.4: Headlamp with spare batteries (50km race only).

rules.1: Mountain Explorer (10km): 3 hours total time limit.
rules.2: Forest Challenge (21km): 5 hours total time limit with a mid-point cut-off at 2.5 hours.
rules.3: Summit Ultra (50km): 12 hours total time limit with cut-offs at 20km (4 hours) and 35km (8 hours).

rules.1: Missing required equipment: 30 minute time penalty.
rules.3: Littering: 1 hour time penalty for first offense, disqualification for second offense.
rules.4: Failure to assist a runner in distress: disqualification.

program.title: Event Program
program.subtitle: Plan your race weekend with our detailed schedule of all events and activities.

finishMeal.title: Post-Race Meal
finishMeal.description: Meal provided by organizers at the finish line

error.title: Message Not Sent
error.message: There was an error sending your message. Please try again.

registration.question: How do I register for the competition?
registration.answer: Registration is available online through our website. Simply go to the Registration section, choose your race, fill out the form, and complete the payment. You'll receive a confirmation email with all the details.

equipment.question: What should I bring on race day?
equipment.answer: Bring your ID, confirmation email, and all the required equipment for your race. Check the Rules section for the specific equipment required for your race distance. Don't forget to dress appropriately for the weather conditions.

stations.question: Are there aid stations on the course?
stations.answer: Yes, there are aid stations along all race routes. The 10km race has 2 aid stations, the 21km race has 4 aid stations, and the 50km race has 8 aid stations. Each aid station provides water, sports drinks, and various snacks.

change.question: Can I change my race after registering?
change.answer: Race changes are possible up to 30 days before the event, subject to availability. To change your race, please contact our support team via email. Note that changing to a more expensive race requires an additional payment, while changing to a less expensive race does not offer a refund of the difference.

sponsors.title: Our Sponsors
sponsors.subtitle: We're grateful to our sponsors who help make this event possible. Their support contributes to an exceptional trail running experience.

footer.about: Join us for an unforgettable trail running experience in the beautiful Carpathian Mountains.
footer.subscribeText: Stay up to date with the latest news and updates about the competition.
footer.privacyNotice: By subscribing, you agree to our privacy policy and consent to receive updates from our team.
footer.copyright: © 2025 Trail Running Competition. All rights reserved.

howToGet.title: How to Get to Stana de Vale
howToGet.subtitle: Practical travel information to help you reach the race destination.
howToGet.introduction: Stana de Vale is a picturesque mountain resort located in the Apuseni Mountains of Romania, offering breathtaking natural landscapes and the perfect setting for our trail running competition.
howToGet.weatherNote: Mountain roads can be affected by weather conditions, especially during winter and early spring. Always check road conditions before traveling.
howToGet.locationDescription: Stana de Vale is situated at an altitude of approximately 1,100 meters in Bihor County, Romania. It's known for its pristine forests, mountain springs, and beautiful hiking trails.

byAir.title: By Air
byAir.description: The closest airports to Stana de Vale are in Oradea and Cluj-Napoca. From there, you can continue your journey by car, train, or bus.

oradea.title: Oradea International Airport (OMR)
oradea.description: The closest airport to Stana de Vale:
oradea.distance: Approximately 70 km from Stana de Vale
oradea.transport: Taxis and car rentals available at the airport

cluj.title: Cluj-Napoca International Airport (CLJ)
cluj.description: A major international airport with more connections:
cluj.distance: Approximately 150 km from Stana de Vale
cluj.transport: Taxis, car rentals, and shuttle services available

byCar.title: By Car
byCar.description: Traveling by car provides flexibility to reach Stana de Vale. The mountain resort is accessible via several routes, though some roads can be challenging depending on the season.

fromOradea.title: From Oradea
fromOradea.description: There are two main routes from Oradea:
fromOradea.route1: Route 1: Oradea → Beiuș → Budureasa → Stana de Vale (approximately 80 km, 1h 45m)
fromOradea.route2: Route 2: Oradea → Aleșd → Borod → Bratca → Beiuș → Budureasa → Stana de Vale (longer but may offer better road conditions)

fromCluj.title: From Cluj-Napoca
fromCluj.route: Cluj-Napoca → Huedin → Borod → Beiuș → Budureasa → Stana de Vale (approximately an 3-hour drive)

parking.title: Parking Information
parking.description: There is a large parking area at the resort center where you can leave your vehicle during the competition. Additional parking will be available near the race start/finish area.

byTrain.title: By Train
byTrain.description: Romania's railway network can get you close to Stana de Vale, though you'll need additional transportation for the final leg of the journey.

connections.title: Train Connections
connections.connection1: From Bucharest: Take a train to Oradea, then continue by bus or car
connections.connection2: From Budapest: Take a train to Oradea, then continue by bus or car

lastLeg.title: Final Connection
lastLeg.description: From either Oradea or Beiuș, you will need to arrange transportation to Stana de Vale as there is no direct train service to the resort.

byBus.title: By Bus
byBus.description: Public bus transport can get you to towns near Stana de Vale, from where you'll need to arrange the final part of your journey.

services.title: Bus Services
services.service1: Oradea to Beiuș: Regular bus services throughout the day
services.service2: Cluj-Napoca to Beiuș: Limited services, check schedules in advance

schedules.title: Bus Schedules
schedules.description: Bus schedules can vary seasonally. We recommend checking the latest timetables at autogari.ro or directly with the local bus companies.

localTransport.title: Local Transportation
localTransport.description: For the final leg of your journey to Stana de Vale, you may need to use local transportation options.

taxis.title: Taxis
taxis.description: Taxis are available in Beiuș and can take you to Stana de Vale. Expect to pay approximately 100-150 RON for this journey.

shuttles.title: Race Day Shuttles
shuttles.description: For the competition, we will arrange shuttle services from major nearby towns. Details will be shared with registered participants closer to the event date.

accommodation.title: Accommodation Options
accommodation.description: There are several accommodation options in and around Stana de Vale to suit different preferences and budgets.

option1.title: Mountain Resort Hotel
option1.description: The main hotel in Stana de Vale offers comfortable rooms with mountain views, restaurant, and spa facilities.

option2.title: Nearby Guesthouses
option2.description: Several family-run guesthouses in the vicinity offer authentic local hospitality and homemade food.

option3.title: Camping
option3.description: For the adventurous, there are designated camping areas near the resort. Bring your own equipment or rent on-site.

sectionsOverview.title: Explore the Competition
sectionsOverview.subtitle: Discover everything you need to know about our trail running competition
sectionsOverview.races: View our challenging trail running races with detailed information about distance, elevation, and difficulty.
sectionsOverview.participants: See who's already registered and check participants from around the world.
sectionsOverview.program: Explore the full schedule of events, including race start times, award ceremonies, and more.
sectionsOverview.rules: Understand the competition rules, equipment requirements, and all safety regulations.
sectionsOverview.emaCircuit: Learn about the EMA Off-Road Running Circuit 2025 and its significance for trail running.
sectionsOverview.sponsors: Discover the organizations and companies supporting this trail running event.
sectionsOverview.registration: Register for your chosen race and secure your spot in this exciting mountain challenge.
sectionsOverview.contact: Get in touch with our team for any questions about the competition.

overview.title: Overview
overview.content: European Masters Athletics (EMA) is proud to announce the inaugural experimental edition of the EMA Off-Road Running Circuit, a circuit dedicated to Master athletes featuring mountain, vertical, and off-road running events.
objectivesList: To provide optimal conditions for athletes to achieve outstanding performances.
To increase competition opportunities in a stimulating and diverse environment.
To foster greater interaction and cultural exchange among athletes.
To offer a broad range of participation options throughout the season.
To promote the diversity of the participating athletes.
overview.focus: The organizational focus will be on delivering well-structured, efficient events that create the best conditions for participants to excel and enjoy the experience.

participation.title: Participation
participation.content: Participation in the EMA Off-Road Running League is open to all athletes who meet the Masters Off-Road running criteria, specifically those aged 35-79, and who hold a valid license from their respective Federation, in accordance with WMA rules.
participation.note1: Please note, the EMA Off-Road Running League is not a championship event, and athletes will not officially represent their countries in these events.
participation.note2: The League is also open to non-European athletes, who will compete for individual event prizes as well as final awards.

liability.title: Liability and Insurance
liability.content: Participants assume full responsibility for their involvement in any event. The Organizer is not liable for any damages or injury sustained by the Participant, except in cases where the damage is the direct result of the Organizer's intentional actions.
liability.insurance: If the Organizer's insurance policy covers the damages, the Organizer's liability will be limited to the amount covered by the insurer. Participants are advised to obtain their own insurance to cover potential risks, such as accidents, illness, or death, that may arise during the event.
liability.health: By registering, participants confirm that they are in good physical and mental health, and have undergone appropriate training to compete in the event. It is recommended that participants undergo a medical examination to ensure fitness for participation.

rankings.title: Rankings
rankings.content: The EMA Off-Road Running Circuit will feature both individual event rankings and a final overall ranking for the Circuit.
rankings.local: Each Local Organizing Committee (LOC) may offer one or more events (such as uphill, vertical, mountain run, trail, etc.), with the winners and age category champions awarded prizes according to their local regulations. Each event will have a dedicated section on the EMA website.
rankings.eligibility: Final Ranking Eligibility: To qualify for the EMA final rankings, athletes must participate in at least two events across different locations.
rankings.points: Point Allocation: The winner of each event (overall and in each age category) will receive 1 point, with subsequent positions awarded points as follows (2 points for second place, 3 points for third, etc.). EMA will consider the best two performances from each athlete when calculating the final standings.
rankings.specialPrize: A special prize will be awarded to all athletes who participate in at least three stages of the Circuit, regardless of their overall results.
rankings.ceremony: The official award ceremony will be held during the 2026 EMA Off-Road Running Championship.

calendar.title: Calendar
calendar.content: The events in the 2025 EMA Off-Road Running Circuit will take place according to the schedule provided on the official EMA website.
